net.antoniy.beacon
Interface Beacon

public interface Beacon

Beacon provides a service for discovering devices in LAN network. It broadcasts UDP datagrams to all devices in the network with preconfigured meta data. Use BeaconFactory to create Beacon instance and BeaconParams for initializing the beacon service.

Author:
Antoniy Chonkov
See Also:
BeaconFactory, BeaconParams

Method Detail

startBeacon

void startBeacon()
Start beacon service. The service executes in separate thread and it does not block the execution of the it's started from. When service is running isBeaconRunning() will return true.

stopBeacon

void stopBeacon()
Stop beacon service. When service is stopped isBeaconRunning() will return false.

updateBeaconData

void updateBeaconData(java.lang.Object newData)
                      throws BeaconException
Update beacon service meta data. That's the data the service broadcasts to other devices in the network. When updating it the new data object must be of the same type as the data class specified in the BeaconParams.

Parameters:
newData - The new data object.
Throws:
BeaconException - when the data is not from the specified in the BeaconParams type or the size of the gson serialized data is greater than the maximum UDP packet size specified.

addBeaconDeviceEventListener

void addBeaconDeviceEventListener(BeaconDeviceEventListener listener)
Add listener for the beacon service device events. Provide BeaconDeviceEventListener instance it will receive the device related events:
  • New device discovered - New device start broadcasting UDP datagrams in the network. Method discoveredBeaconDevice(DeviceInfo) is invoked.
  • Device updated - A device changed the meta data it broadcasts. Method updateBeaconDevice(DeviceInfo) is invoked.
  • Device removed - A device hasn't been broadcasting for more time than the specified timeout. Method removeBeaconDevice(DeviceInfo) is invoked.

Parameters:
listener - is the BeaconDeviceEventListener instance that will handle the device events.
See Also:
BeaconDeviceEventListener

getActiveDevices

java.util.List<DeviceInfo> getActiveDevices()
                                            throws BeaconStoppedException
Retrieve the list of currently active devices in the network. Active is considered a device that keeps broadcasting UDP datagrams in the network and does that frequently enough so the timeout, provided by the developer, is not reached.

Returns:
a list of DeviceInfo instances.
Throws:
BeaconStoppedException
See Also:
DeviceInfo

isBeaconRunning

boolean isBeaconRunning()
Check if the beacon service is running or not.

Returns:
true if the beacon service is running, false - otherwise.

addBeaconEventListener

void addBeaconEventListener(BeaconEventListener listener)
Add listener for beacon service events. Provide BeaconEventListener instance to handle beacon service events.

Parameters:
listener - The BeaconEventListener instance that will handle the beacon service events.
See Also:
BeaconEventListener
